Issues.Title: refactor(compiler-cli): include `template` source directly inside declaration object
Issues.Body:
The `template` and `isInline` fields were previously stored in a nested
object, which was initially done to accommodate for additional template
information to support accurate source maps for external templates. In
the meantime the source mapping has been accomplished in a different
way, and I feel this flattened structure is simpler and smaller so is
preferable over the nested object. This change also makes the `isInline`
property optional with a default value of `false`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(compiler-cli): include `template` source directly inside declaration object" (#40383)

Issues.Title: docs: sort entries in contributors.json alphabetically
Issues.Body:
Currently entries in the `contributors.json` file are not sorted and new entries are typically added at the very
end of the file, which is often causing merge conflicts. This commit updates the `contributors.json` to have all
entries sorted in alphabetical order (based on GitHub handles), which should reduce the number of merge conflicts.

Issues.Title: feat(docs-infra): add shortcuts for the angular.io PWA
Issues.Body:
This commits adds some shortcut definitions for the angular.io PWA. The user agent can use them to assemble a context menu to be displayed by the operating system when a user engages with the app's icon. (In addition, shortcuts provide an easy way for users to add links to specific pages on their home screen.)

See [here][1] for more details on the `shortcuts` property of the PWA manifest.

The choice of pages to create shortcuts to was influenced by the following facts/criteria:
- It seems that only the first 4 shortcuts are displayed by Chrome (at least on my Android phone).
- Since the PWA is mostly used on mobile, I omitted pages that are less likely to be useful for mobile users (such as pages related to CLI).

##
**TODO**

- [ ] Decide what icons to use (if any). (See https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40393#issuecomment-758189046.)

[1]: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/Manifest/shortcuts
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(docs-infra): add shortcuts for the angular.io PWA" (#40393)

Issues.Title: fix(compiler-cli): prevent stack overflow in decorator transform for large number of files
Issues.Body:
The decorator downleveling transform patches `ts.EmitResolver.isReferencedAliasDeclaration`
to prevent elision of value imports that occur only in a type-position, which would
inadvertently install the patch repeatedly for each source file in the program.
This could potentially result in a stack overflow when a very large number of files is
present in the program.

This commit fixes the issue by ensuring that the patch is only applied once.
This is also a slight performance improvement, as `isReferencedAliasDeclaration`
is no longer repeatedly calling into all prior installed patch functions.

Fixes #40276
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(compiler-cli): prevent stack overflow in decorator transform for large number of files" (#40374)

Issues.Title: fix(ngcc): compute the correct package paths for a target entry-points
Issues.Body:
Previously, if an entry-point started with the string of another package that
is included in `paths` mappings, then the base path was incorrectly computed
resulting in the wrong package path for the entry point.

Now we not only check whether the target path "starts with" the base path
but then also whether the target path is actually contained in the base path
from a file-system directory point of view.

Fixes #40352
Fixes #40357
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "fix(ngcc): compute the correct package paths for a target entry-points" (#40376)

Issues.Title: Mandatory inputs, missing attributes vs undefined values
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ 

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/compiler


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> While using strict mode, if we have a component which has an mandatory input `@Input() value!: string` and we do not provide any value in the template, the compiler does not complain. But, if we do provide `undefined` as a value, the compiler complains, as the value couldn't be `undefined`, even though at runtime, they are both the same. 
Having that many components have inputs that are technically mandatory, as the components could not properly run without them, having this kind of type checking should provide allot of value.

I know that this was discussed in the past, but having that now, Angular started promoting strict mode, maybe we should address this again.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Treat the missing attributes as if `undefined` was provided as value. As there is no runtime difference between them.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> I've considered the workarounds that were recommended in other places, but none of them were satisfactory:
- using the selector to make it mandatory 'prefix-component[value]' -- But the errors received here, are misleading, as it complains that the component does not exist, instead of complaining about the attribute type. 
- throwing errors at runtime -- Again, this is wrong, as this should be a compilation error, because it's not different than a function with parameters or class constructor with parameters. Why should the component be any different? Besides this, pushing typing errors at runtime isn't a good practice, as it defeats the purpose of TypeScript and also increases the change that the issue will go unnoticed, if this is an edge case.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Mandatory inputs, missing attributes vs undefined values" (#40390)

Issues.Body:
## PR Checklist
Please check if your PR fulfills the following requirements:

- [x] The commit message follows our guidelines: https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit
- [x] Tests for the changes have been added (for bug fixes / features)
- [x] Docs have been added / updated (for bug fixes / features)


## PR Type
What kind of change does this PR introduce?

- [x] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update (formatting, local variables)
- [ ] Refactoring (no functional changes, no api changes)
- [ ] Build related changes
- [ ] CI related changes
- [ ] Documentation content changes
- [ ] angular.io application / infrastructure changes
- [ ] Other... Please describe:


## What is the current behavior?
This PR addresses the issues found in the issues #22842, PR #26557,  PR #36760, PR #26557

It also replaces the PR for #26557 which has a number of issues and is an 


By forcing the subscription to close if a module has a lazy sub-module then the these are passed to the PreloadingStrategy class as the observable has already terminated.
It doesn't actually prevent the load as the fetch may overlap with the preload fetch. Ie both the pre-loader and navigation can start a load both will finish.
Issue Number: #26557, #22842


## What is the new behavior?
By Prevent loading a route module twice, we prevent the sending of multiple RouteConfigLoadEnd events, and the duplicate console log as show in the stackbiz example on #26557

## Does this PR introduce a breaking change?

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

## Other information
This is an updated version of my originally and closed PR #36760 (due to my failure to update) but addressing @atscott comments.

Issues.Title: Ivy no longer report invalid structural directives / schema errors on NgTemplate
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package I believe the issue is caused by package `@angular/compiler` ### Is this a regression? Yes, it used to throw an error with ViewEngine, and no longer does with Ivy. ### Description The Angular compiler used to throw errors an invalid structural directives, e.g.: ``` My template is here ``` ``` Error: Can't bind to 'ngTemplateOutle' since it isn't a known property of 'ng-container'. 1. If 'ngTemplateOutle' is an Angular directive, then add 'CommonModule' to the '@NgModule.imports' of this component. 2. To allow any property add 'NO_ERRORS_SCHEMA' to the '@NgModule.schemas' of this component. (" ]*ngTemplateOutle="myTemplate"> My template is here") Property binding ngTemplateOutle not used by any directive on an embedded template. Make sure that the property name is spelled correctly and all directives are listed in the "@NgModule.declarations". (" [ERROR ->] My te") ``` With Ivy & AOT with all the strict Angular template flags enabled the above code compiles fine, i.e. no error is thrown, which I've learned the hard way. Not throwing any compile or runtime error on invalid Angular templates makes working with them more dangerous than it should be. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Minimal reproduction in https://github.com/laurentgoudet/angular-ivy-no-error-invalid-structural-directive. https://github.com/laurentgoudet/angular-ivy-no-error-invalid-structural-directive/blob/master/src/app/app.component.ts contains the broken code, which by default compiles with no error. Swapping `enableIvy` to `false` in https://github.com/laurentgoudet/angular-ivy-no-error-invalid-structural-directive/blob/master/tsconfig.json makes the compiler throw an error. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 11.0.6
Node: 12.4.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.7
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic, router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                         Version
---------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect       0.1100.6
@angular-devkit/build-angular   0.1100.6
@angular-devkit/core            11.0.6
@angular-devkit/schematics      11.0.6
@angular/cli                    11.0.6
@schematics/angular             11.0.6
@schematics/update              0.1100.6
rxjs                            6.6.3
typescript                      4.0.5

Issues.Title: Memory leak in tests with zone.js >= 0.9.0
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package: **zone.js: 0.9.0** ### Is this a regression? Yes. The tests didn't cause Chrome to crash. ### Description When I've upgraded zone.js from 0.8.26 to 0.9.0 or higher, this problem appeared. I have 3000 unit/integration tests. We use heavily dynamic component creation. Our tests currently cannot be executed at once, because zone.js(the timers patch) keeps a reference to tasks created from **setTimeout()** in **tasksByHandleId** in the patch method. When I call **clearTimeout()** in ngOnDestroy() I can see that the task is not removed from tasksByHandleId because it's status is **notScheduled**. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction [Reproduction](https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-omxwmy?file=src/app/app.component.ts) ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:**

Issues.Title: User `ngTemplateOutletContext` been modified unexpectedly
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/core ### Is this a regression? No ### Description User `ngTemplateOutletContext` is been modified at https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/src/directives/ng_template_outlet.ts#L104 because the `_viewRef.context` is pointed at https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/core/src/render3/instructions/shared.ts#L137. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-tstyd6?file=src%2Fcomponents%2Fselect.component.ts ## üî• Exception or Error Click `label: option2-5`, the top value will change correctly, be then click `label: option1` the top value will not change which is incorrect. This is because the `ngTemplateOutletContext` is pointed to the first context and always been modified, but when clicking `label: option1`, the context has been changed to last context content https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/common/src/directives/ng_template_outlet.ts#L68. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 



Angular CLI: 11.0.3
Node: 12.20.0
OS: darwin x64

Angular: 11.0.3

Issues.Title: Angular 11.0.6 and 11.0.7: Componentless routes broken in IE11 when navigating
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package The issue is caused by package @angular/router ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: 11.0.5 ### Description Trying to activate a route in IE11 using Angular 11.0.6 or 11.0.7 with default Angular CLI polyfill configuration results in an error about Object.values not being found, as IE11 doesn't support that by default. A similar defect with Object.entries was fixed in Angular 11.0.7. I searched the code base briefly and could not find any other usages of either function in any code that can be used at runtime. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction StackBlitz doesn't support IE11, but basically any HelloWorld application for Angular routing that contains a componentless route will produce the issue by simply clicking to a different route. ## üî• Exception or Error 


 TypeError: Object doesn't support property or method 'values'
## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 




     _                      _                 ____ _     ___
    / \   _ __   __ _ _   _| | __ _ _ __     / ___| |   |_ _|
   / ‚ñ≥ \ | '_ \ / _` | | | | |/ _` | '__|   | |   | |    | |
  / ___ \| | | | (_| | |_| | | (_| | |      | |___| |___ | |
 /_/   \_\_| |_|\__, |\__,_|_|\__,_|_|       \____|_____|___|
                |___/

**Anything else relevant?** This is specific only to browsers that do not support Object.values when using default polyfill configuration from Angular CLI. (The only one I care about is IE11, although I'm not sure if that's the only one in the list of browsers supported by Angular.) I can easily add a polyfill for Object.values, but Angular itself shouldn't require any modifications to the default polyfills provided by the CLI simply to run out-of-the-box functionality. N/A

Issues.Title: fix(router): Remove usage of `Object.values` to avoid the need for a ‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶polyfill

`Object.values` is not supported in IE11 without a polyfill. The quickest,
most straightfoward fix for this is to simply use `Object.keys` instead.
We may want to consider including the polyfill in the CLI in the future
or just wait until IE11 support is dropped before using
`Object.values`.

Fixes #40372

Issues.Title: No component or global styling works after porting components from ng 8 to ng 11 and converting components from css -> scss
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [`x`] serve ### Is this a regression? Project components and styling worked on a previous angular 8 repo with the same components but problem started happening after updating cli and core to latest (11). ### Description Had an ng 8 repo with existing components that were using global and component level css for styling. Needed to add these same components to a monorepo (ng11 and nativecript 7) that by default was set to use .scss for all styles. I manually ported over the files by adding new folders/files in the code base and set the extension for all component styling files to be .scss then copy and pasted over the css from my ng 8 project. After doing all this and running ng serve in my monorepo none of my component or global styles are showing up when I compile. I am using reset.scss in the code base as well. Another dev on my team has pulled down my same branch and compiled with no issues and all his styling at the component and global levels are working correctly, which lead us to believe it is an issue with my local machine. Possibly something with cli and the fact that I previously was working in .css projects then switched to .scss? ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction Create a .css ng 8 project and add some basic styling. Then port over that styling to a separate new ng11/ns monorepo project that uses .scss by manually creating the component folders and files then copy and pasting .css from ng 8 project in and run ng serve. ## üåç Your Environment

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v3.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​300-httpsgithubcombazelbuildrulesnodejscompare300-rc1300-2020-12-22)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.2...3.0.0)

> ### For a full list for the breaking changes in 3.0.0 and other notes on migrating, see the [Migrating to 3.0.0 wiki](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/wiki#migrating-to-30) page.
>
> ##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** only pass kwargs to the test, not the .update binary ([#​2361](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2361)) ([afa095b](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/afa095b))

##### Code Refactoring

-   **builtin:** remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test & ts_library ([c2927af](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c2927af))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **builtin:** We removed the node_modules attribute from `nodejs_binary`, `nodejs_test`, `jasmine_node_test` & `ts_library`.

If you are using the `node_modules` attribute, you can simply add the target specified there to the `data` or `deps` attribute of the rule instead.

For example,

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            "@​npm//:node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

or

    ts_library(
        name = "lib",
        srcs = glob(["*.ts"]),
        tsconfig = ":tsconfig.json",
        deps = ["@​npm//:node_modules"],
    )

We also dropped support for filegroup based node_modules target and removed `node_modules_filegroup` from `index.bzl`.

If you are using this feature for user-managed deps, you must now a `js_library` target
with `external_npm_package` set to `True` instead.

For example,

    js_library(
        name = "node_modules",
        srcs = glob(
            include = [
                "node_modules/**/*.js",
                "node_modules/**/*.d.ts",
                "node_modules/**/*.json",
                "node_modules/.bin/*",
            ],
            exclude = [
    ### Files under test & docs may contain file names that
    ### are not legal Bazel labels (e.g.,
    ### node_modules/ecstatic/test/public/‰∏≠Êñá/Ê™îÊ°à.html)
                "node_modules/**/test/**",
                "node_modules/**/docs/**",
    ### Files with spaces in the name are not legal Bazel labels
                "node_modules/**/* */**",
                "node_modules/**/* *",
            ],
        ),
    ### Provide ExternalNpmPackageInfo which is used by downstream rules
    ### that use these npm dependencies
        external_npm_package = True,
    )

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            ":node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

See `examples/user_managed_deps` for a working example of user-managed npm dependencies.

### [`v2.3.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/2.3.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.1...2.3.2)

**Note**: this is likely the last 2.x release of rules_nodejs, we expect 3.0.0 next week.

To upgrade:

    http_archive(
        name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",
        sha256 = "b3521b29c7cb0c47a1a735cce7e7e811a4f80d8e3720cf3a1b624533e4bb7cb6",
        urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/2.3.2/rules_nodejs-2.3.2.tar.gz"],
    )

and update your `@bazel`-scoped npm packages to `latest`

##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** add DeclarationInfo sources from dependencies as inputs to npm_package_bin driven actions ([#​2353](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2353)) ([85dc132](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/85dc132))
-   **builtin:** give better error when linker runs on Node <10 ([c344401](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c344401)), closes [#​2304](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2304)
-   **examples:** fix jest example on windows ([cc04f6c](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cc04f6c)), closes [#​1454](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1454)

##### Features

-   allow running NPM tools from execroot ([#​2297](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2297)) ([364ac89](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/364ac89))

</details>

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/bazel-toolchains</summary>

### [`v3.7.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/bazel-toolchains/releases/3.7.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/bazel-toolchains/compare/3.7.1...3.7.2)

SHA256:1caf8584434d3e31be674067996be787cfa511fda2a0f05811131b588886477f

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v3.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​300-httpsgithubcombazelbuildrulesnodejscompare300-rc1300-2020-12-22)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.2...3.0.0)

> ### For a full list for the breaking changes in 3.0.0 and other notes on migrating, see the [Migrating to 3.0.0 wiki](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/wiki#migrating-to-30) page.
>
> ##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** only pass kwargs to the test, not the .update binary ([#​2361](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2361)) ([afa095b](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/afa095b))

##### Code Refactoring

-   **builtin:** remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test & ts_library ([c2927af](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c2927af))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **builtin:** We removed the node_modules attribute from `nodejs_binary`, `nodejs_test`, `jasmine_node_test` & `ts_library`.

If you are using the `node_modules` attribute, you can simply add the target specified there to the `data` or `deps` attribute of the rule instead.

For example,

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            "@​npm//:node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

or

    ts_library(
        name = "lib",
        srcs = glob(["*.ts"]),
        tsconfig = ":tsconfig.json",
        deps = ["@​npm//:node_modules"],
    )

We also dropped support for filegroup based node_modules target and removed `node_modules_filegroup` from `index.bzl`.

If you are using this feature for user-managed deps, you must now a `js_library` target
with `external_npm_package` set to `True` instead.

For example,

    js_library(
        name = "node_modules",
        srcs = glob(
            include = [
                "node_modules/**/*.js",
                "node_modules/**/*.d.ts",
                "node_modules/**/*.json",
                "node_modules/.bin/*",
            ],
            exclude = [
    ### Files under test & docs may contain file names that
    ### are not legal Bazel labels (e.g.,
    ### node_modules/ecstatic/test/public/‰∏≠Êñá/Ê™îÊ°à.html)
                "node_modules/**/test/**",
                "node_modules/**/docs/**",
    ### Files with spaces in the name are not legal Bazel labels
                "node_modules/**/* */**",
                "node_modules/**/* *",
            ],
        ),
    ### Provide ExternalNpmPackageInfo which is used by downstream rules
    ### that use these npm dependencies
        external_npm_package = True,
    )

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            ":node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

See `examples/user_managed_deps` for a working example of user-managed npm dependencies.

### [`v2.3.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/2.3.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.1...2.3.2)

**Note**: this is likely the last 2.x release of rules_nodejs, we expect 3.0.0 next week.

To upgrade:

    http_archive(
        name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",
        sha256 = "b3521b29c7cb0c47a1a735cce7e7e811a4f80d8e3720cf3a1b624533e4bb7cb6",
        urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/2.3.2/rules_nodejs-2.3.2.tar.gz"],
    )

and update your `@bazel`-scoped npm packages to `latest`

##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** add DeclarationInfo sources from dependencies as inputs to npm_package_bin driven actions ([#​2353](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2353)) ([85dc132](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/85dc132))
-   **builtin:** give better error when linker runs on Node <10 ([c344401](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c344401)), closes [#​2304](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2304)
-   **examples:** fix jest example on windows ([cc04f6c](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cc04f6c)), closes [#​1454](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1454)

##### Features

-   allow running NPM tools from execroot ([#​2297](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2297)) ([364ac89](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/364ac89))

Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [x] build - [ ] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] extract-i18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was: `v6.0.3` ### Description While updating an Angular Library based on `v6.0.3` to `v11.0.6`, the following issue is encountered. After updating d3 to `v6.2.0` and Angular to latest `v11.0.6`, getting the following error while doing `ng build --prod`. Earlier with d3 `v5.4.0` and Angular `v6.0.3`, everything was working fine. ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction It seems that `event` is being referred from the following code: ``` import * as d3 from 'd3'; // Save x,y cordinates on drag start. this.originalX = d3.event.x; this.originalY = d3.event.y; d3.event.sourceEvent.stopPropagation(); ``` After googling a bit, someone suggested to install `@types/d3` and then try; but after installing it, Webstorm starts to throw error on the usage of `d3.event`. ``` TS2339: Property 'event' does not exist on type 'typeof import("/node_modules/@types/d3/index")'. ``` ## üî• Exception or Error 

"export 'event' was not found in 'd3'
    at HarmonyImportSpecifierDependency._getErrors (\node_modules\webpack\lib\dependencies\HarmonyImportSpecifierDependency.js:109:11)
    at HarmonyImportSpecifierDependency.getErrors (\node_modules\webpack\lib\dependencies\HarmonyImportSpecifierDependency.js:68:16)
    at Compilation.reportDependencyErrorsAndWarnings (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:1463:22)
    at hooks.finishModules.callAsync.err (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:1258:10)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.eval [as callAsync] (eval at create (\node_modules\webpack\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), :53:1)
    at AsyncSeriesHook.lazyCompileHook (\node_modules\webpack\node_modules\tapable\lib\Hook.js:154:20)
    at Compilation.finish (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:1253:28)
    at hooks.make.callAsync.err (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compiler.js:672:17)
    at _done (eval at create (\node_modules\webpack\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), :9:1)
    at _err1 (eval at create (\node_modules\webpack\node_modules\tapable\lib\HookCodeFactory.js:33:10), :36:22)
    at _addModuleChain (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:1185:12)
    at processModuleDependencies.err (\node_modules\webpack\lib\Compilation.js:1097:9)
    at process._tickCallback (internal/process/next_tick.js:61:11)
 @ ./src/app/app.module.ngfactory.js
 @ ./src/main.ts
 @ multi ./src/main.ts
## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI: 11.0.6
Node: 10.15.0
OS: win32 x64

### Release Notes

<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v3.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​300-httpsgithubcombazelbuildrulesnodejscompare300-rc1300-2020-12-22)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.2...3.0.0)

> ### For a full list for the breaking changes in 3.0.0 and other notes on migrating, see the [Migrating to 3.0.0 wiki](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/wiki#migrating-to-30) page.
>
> ##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** only pass kwargs to the test, not the .update binary ([#​2361](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2361)) ([afa095b](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/afa095b))

##### Code Refactoring

-   **builtin:** remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test & ts_library ([c2927af](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c2927af))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **builtin:** We removed the node_modules attribute from `nodejs_binary`, `nodejs_test`, `jasmine_node_test` & `ts_library`.

If you are using the `node_modules` attribute, you can simply add the target specified there to the `data` or `deps` attribute of the rule instead.

For example,

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            "@​npm//:node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

or

    ts_library(
        name = "lib",
        srcs = glob(["*.ts"]),
        tsconfig = ":tsconfig.json",
        deps = ["@​npm//:node_modules"],
    )

We also dropped support for filegroup based node_modules target and removed `node_modules_filegroup` from `index.bzl`.

If you are using this feature for user-managed deps, you must now a `js_library` target
with `external_npm_package` set to `True` instead.

For example,

    js_library(
        name = "node_modules",
        srcs = glob(
            include = [
                "node_modules/**/*.js",
                "node_modules/**/*.d.ts",
                "node_modules/**/*.json",
                "node_modules/.bin/*",
            ],
            exclude = [
    ### Files under test & docs may contain file names that
    ### are not legal Bazel labels (e.g.,
    ### node_modules/ecstatic/test/public/‰∏≠Êñá/Ê™îÊ°à.html)
                "node_modules/**/test/**",
                "node_modules/**/docs/**",
    ### Files with spaces in the name are not legal Bazel labels
                "node_modules/**/* */**",
                "node_modules/**/* *",
            ],
        ),
    ### Provide ExternalNpmPackageInfo which is used by downstream rules
    ### that use these npm dependencies
        external_npm_package = True,
    )

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            ":node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

See `examples/user_managed_deps` for a working example of user-managed npm dependencies.

### [`v2.3.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/2.3.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.1...2.3.2)

**Note**: this is likely the last 2.x release of rules_nodejs, we expect 3.0.0 next week.

    http_archive(
        name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",

        urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/2.3.2/rules_nodejs-2.3.2.tar.gz"],
    )

and update your `@bazel`-scoped npm packages to `latest`

##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** add DeclarationInfo sources from dependencies as inputs to npm_package_bin driven actions ([#​2353](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2353)) ([85dc132](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/85dc132))
-   **builtin:** give better error when linker runs on Node <10 ([c344401](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c344401)), closes [#​2304](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2304)
-   **examples:** fix jest example on windows ([cc04f6c](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cc04f6c)), closes [#​1454](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1454)

##### Features

-   allow running NPM tools from execroot ([#​2297](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2297)) ([364ac89](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/364ac89))

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>bazelbuild/rules_nodejs</summary>

### [`v3.0.0`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md#​300-httpsgithubcombazelbuildrulesnodejscompare300-rc1300-2020-12-22)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.2...3.0.0)

> ### For a full list for the breaking changes in 3.0.0 and other notes on migrating, see the [Migrating to 3.0.0 wiki](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/wiki#migrating-to-30) page.
>
> ##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** only pass kwargs to the test, not the .update binary ([#​2361](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2361)) ([afa095b](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/afa095b))

##### Code Refactoring

-   **builtin:** remove node_modules attribute from nodejs_binary, nodejs_test & ts_library ([c2927af](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c2927af))

##### BREAKING CHANGES

-   **builtin:** We removed the node_modules attribute from `nodejs_binary`, `nodejs_test`, `jasmine_node_test` & `ts_library`.

If you are using the `node_modules` attribute, you can simply add the target specified there to the `data` or `deps` attribute of the rule instead.

For example,

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            "@​npm//:node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

or

    ts_library(
        name = "lib",
        srcs = glob(["*.ts"]),
        tsconfig = ":tsconfig.json",
        deps = ["@​npm//:node_modules"],
    )

We also dropped support for filegroup based node_modules target and removed `node_modules_filegroup` from `index.bzl`.

If you are using this feature for user-managed deps, you must now a `js_library` target
with `external_npm_package` set to `True` instead.

For example,

    js_library(
        name = "node_modules",
        srcs = glob(
            include = [
                "node_modules/**/*.js",
                "node_modules/**/*.d.ts",
                "node_modules/**/*.json",
                "node_modules/.bin/*",
            ],
            exclude = [
    ### Files under test & docs may contain file names that
    ### are not legal Bazel labels (e.g.,
    ### node_modules/ecstatic/test/public/‰∏≠Êñá/Ê™îÊ°à.html)
                "node_modules/**/test/**",
                "node_modules/**/docs/**",
    ### Files with spaces in the name are not legal Bazel labels
                "node_modules/**/* */**",
                "node_modules/**/* *",
            ],
        ),
    ### Provide ExternalNpmPackageInfo which is used by downstream rules
    ### that use these npm dependencies
        external_npm_package = True,
    )

    nodejs_test(
        name = "test",
        data = [
            "test.js",
            ":node_modules",
        ],
        entry_point = "test.js",
    )

See `examples/user_managed_deps` for a working example of user-managed npm dependencies.

### [`v2.3.2`](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/2.3.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/compare/2.3.1...2.3.2)

**Note**: this is likely the last 2.x release of rules_nodejs, we expect 3.0.0 next week.

To upgrade:

    http_archive(
        name = "build_bazel_rules_nodejs",
        sha256 = "b3521b29c7cb0c47a1a735cce7e7e811a4f80d8e3720cf3a1b624533e4bb7cb6",
        urls = ["https://github.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/releases/download/2.3.2/rules_nodejs-2.3.2.tar.gz"],
    )

and update your `@bazel`-scoped npm packages to `latest`

##### Bug Fixes

-   **builtin:** add DeclarationInfo sources from dependencies as inputs to npm_package_bin driven actions ([#​2353](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2353)) ([85dc132](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/85dc132))
-   **builtin:** give better error when linker runs on Node <10 ([c344401](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/c344401)), closes [#​2304](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2304)
-   **examples:** fix jest example on windows ([cc04f6c](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/cc04f6c)), closes [#​1454](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/1454)

##### Features

-   allow running NPM tools from execroot ([#​2297](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/issues/2297)) ([364ac89](https://togithub.com/bazelbuild/rules_nodejs/commit/364ac89))

</details>

Issues.Title: docs-bug(ripple): Incorrectly says that animations will be disabled from NoopAnimationsModule
Issues.Body:
#### Documentation Feedback

Documentation for the ripple config's `animation` value says:
```
Configuration for the animation duration of the ripples. There are two phases with different durations for the ripples. The animation durations will be overwritten if the¬†NoopAnimationsModule¬†is being used.
```

However, the implementation gives importance to the input over the module:
```
animation: {
        ...this._globalOptions.animation,
        ...(this._animationMode === 'NoopAnimations' ? {enterDuration: 0, exitDuration: 0} : {}),
        ...this.animation
      },
```

**Affected documentation page:** https://material.angular.io/components/ripple/api#RippleGlobalOptions
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "docs-bug(ripple): Incorrectly says that animations will be disabled from NoopAnimationsModule" (#21541)

Issues.Title: bug(DIALOG): Dialog's content jump around after opening

- Components: https://stackblitz.com/edit/components-issue-1fvgvm

Steps to reproduce:
1. Click on "Basic Button"
2. See odd behaviour
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

Dialog appeared and no content re-drawing appears


#### Actual Behavior

You see the panels are open and immediately change to closed. This sudden change makes it very unappealing to the eye.


#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.7 (10.1.0 on my PC)
- CDK/Material: 11.0.3 (10.2.5 on my PC)
- Browser(s): Chrome, but probably all
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): independant

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/testing): protractor element not extracting hidden text
Issues.Body:
We use Protractor's `getText` method to extract text, but the problem is that it's likely based on `HTMLElement.innerText` which excludes text from hidden elements.

These changes switch to using `textContent` to bring the behavior in-line with the `UnitTestElement`.

Issues.Body: The `axe-webdriverjs` package was deprecated in favor of `@axe-core/webdriverjs`. These changes switch to the new package, fix the new failures that were picked up and clean up some repetitive code.

Issues.Title: fix(material/tabs): background color inherited to nested groups
Issues.Body:
Fixes that setting a `backgroundColor` on a top-level tab group ends up being inherited to all grounds nested within it. The problem was that our selectors were too broad and they were targeting all descendants.

Fixes #14819.
Fixes #21530.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/tabs): background color inherited to nested groups" (#21533)

Issues.Title: fix(material-experimental/mdc-radio): de-duplicate test harness logic
Issues.Body: Changes the MDC-based radio harnesses to extend the base ones directly since the logic is identical, aside from some selectors.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material-experimental/mdc-radio): de-duplicate test harness logic" (#21532)

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): nested menu trigger not restoring focus
Issues.Body:
Fixes that navigating back from a nested menu using the keyboard doesn't restore focus to the previous trigger, breaking the interaction since it ends up going back to the `body`. This used to work, but seems to have regressed at some point.

**Note:** marking as a P2, because the current behavior completely breaks the keyboard navigation between nested menus.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/menu): nested menu trigger not restoring focus" (#21531)

Issues.Title: build: update to rules_nodejs 2.3.2
Issues.Body: Updates `rules_nodejs` and related dependencies to 2.3.2 as a precursor to updating to 3.0. Relates to https://github.com/angular/angular/pull/40367.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "build: update to rules_nodejs 2.3.2" (#21528)

Issues.Title: fix(material/menu): focus indication rendering partially in high contrast mode
Issues.Body:
Firefox seems to have an issue where the items cut off each other's outline in high contrast mode. These changes work around the issue by introducing a slight margin.

Note that this isn't ideal, because the whole point of using an outline is so that the layout isn't different on high contrast mode. The alternate approach is to use a `border`, but it will cause the element to move around as the user is navigating.

Fixes #21524.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(material/menu): focus indication rendering partially in high contrast mode" (#21527)

Issues.Title: fix(cdk/drag-drop): support for nested drop containers (#16671)
Issues.Body:
Fixes a two issues with nested drop containers. The first fixed issue is that the elements of
cdkDropListConnectedTo previously had to be ordered correctly to support moving items into an
inner drop container. Sepcifically, inner drop containers had to be listed before their outer
ancestors. The second fixed issue is that items of an inner container could not be re-ordered
without moving the item out of the container and then back in.

Fixes #16671
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(cdk/drag-drop): support for nested drop containers (#16671)" (#21526)

Issues.Title: bug(mat-menu): In high contrast mode, borders not fully visible around mat-menu-items
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz: https://stackblitz.com/angular/ooebrkdoyjb?file=src/app/menu-overview-example.html

Steps to reproduce:
1. Enable Windows high contrast mode in settings
2. Open firefox
3. Create a mat-menu with 3+ options (Stackblitz above)
4. Open the menu and navigate through the options
 
 
#### Expected Behavior

What behavior were you expecting to see?
Both the top and bottom borders should be visible around menu items. 

#### Actual Behavior

What behavior did you actually see?
Only the last item shows both borders. The other items only show one border when active.

#### Environment

- Angular: 11.0.3
- CDK/Material: 11.0.3
- Browser(s): Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu):  Windows

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11365475/104066053-5c5e7200-51c6-11eb-8513-2a93220d418f.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(mat-menu): In high contrast mode, borders not fully visible around mat-menu-items" (#21524)

Issues.Title: feat(material/option): Update styles to be responsive to small window sizes.
Issues.Body: To conform to WCAG 2.1 need all content to appear on windows of width 320px. Currently options do not wrap, so content is cut off. This will make option more responsive.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/option): Update styles to be responsive to small window sizes. " (#21523)

Issues.Title: feat(CdkOverlay): bring it back excludeFromOutsideClick
Issues.Body:
#### Feature Description
If I not missing up something, I remember in material v10. there is a overlay config "excludeFromOutsideClick" allow us to set some custom logic about outside click. but I can't found it in v11.

version 10
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/104051063-7d54b080-5222-11eb-9dc0-83f997f3a5d2.png)

version 11
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/104051103-8ba2cc80-5222-11eb-8b30-9af8548598c9.png)


#### Use Case
When clicking Google ads menu trigger button, the menu won't close. 
If I try to implement it using CDK overlay, the menu will close when clicking the trigger button. because the button is outside of overlay.

Google Ads
![dada1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/104051286-e0dede00-5222-11eb-86b5-56fa6c7d85de.gif)

CDK Overlay
![dada11](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8691013/104051703-81cd9900-5223-11eb-89e8-b687275971ff.gif)

Please consider bring it back.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "feat(CdkOverlay): bring it back excludeFromOutsideClick " (#21521)
